page.title: 06GEOLOGICAL SURVEY
page.content:
THE AREA CONSISTS ALMOST ENTIRELY OF SEDIMENTARY ROCKS WITH SMALL FAULTED OUTCROPS OF IGNEOUS BASALTS AND TUFFS. THE SEDIMENTARY ROCKS DATE FROM THE CARBONIFEROUS AND TRIASSIC PERIODS BUT THERE ARE ALSO SOME COMPARATIVELY RECENT DEPOSITS ASSOCIATED WITH THE QUATERNERY ICE AGE. THERE IS A MARKED RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN TOPOGRAPHIC RELIEF AND ROCK TYPE. THE OLDER CARBONIFEROUS LIMESTONES ARE HARD AND RESISTANT TO EROSION AND NOW FORM THE HILLS, BUT THE TRIASSIC MUDSTONES AND MARLS ARE WEAKER AND NOW FORM THE LOWER GROUND. THE GEOLOGY ALSO GOVERNS SOIL-TYPE WHICH, IN TURN INFLUENCES LAND-USE. THE SOILS DEVELOPED ON THE LIMESTONES ARE THIN AND OF LIMITED AGRICULTURAL POTENTIAL AND ARE GENERALLY WOODED.
CONTINUED ON PAGE 7
